0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• safety and efficacy in end stage renal disease (ESRD) patients who are not on hemodialysis have not been established
  • End stage renal disease - Hemodialysis - Hyperphosphatemia: serum phosphorus between 5.5 and 7.5 mg/dL, initial, 800 mg ORALLY 3 times a day with meals
  • End stage renal disease - Hemodialysis - Hyperphosphatemia: serum phosphorus between 7.5 and 9 mg/dL, initial, 1200-1600 mg ORALLY 3 times a day with meals
  • End stage renal disease - Hemodialysis - Hyperphosphatemia: serum phosphorus greater than 9 mg/dL, 1600 mg ORALLY 3 times a day with meals
  • End stage renal disease - Hemodialysis - Hyperphosphatemia: dose titration, serum phosphorus greater than 5.5 mg/dL, increase by 400 mg per meal at 2 week intervals (max dose 4 g); serum phosphorus 3.5-5.5 mg/dL, maintain current dose; serum phosphorus less than 3.5 mg/dL, decrease by 400 mg per meal

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy have not been established

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
End stage renal disease - Hemodialysis - Hyperphosphatemia

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• swallowing disorders; dysphagia and esophageal tablet retention have been reported, some severe requiring intervention and hospitalization; consider change to suspension
  • bowel obstruction and intestinal perforation have been reported
  • report known or suspected adverse events to the United States Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Sevelamer: Micromedex: Infant risk is minimal.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Gastrointestinal:Abdominal pain (9%), Constipation (8%), Diarrhea (19%), Flatulence (8%), Indigestion (16%), Nausea (20%), Vomiting (22%)
Serious
Gastrointestinal:Bowel obstruction, Perforation of intestine, Peritonitis (8%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Sevelamer hydrochloride, a polymeric phosphate binder, inhibits intestinal phosphate absorption and reduces low-density lipoprotein (LDL) and total serum cholesterol levels.

0.title: Absorption
0.mono:
• Bioavailability: oral: not systemically absorbed
  • Effects of food: should be given with meals but not with enteral nutrition

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • medications whose bioavailability, safety, and efficacy may be significantly affected by concurrent administration with sevelamer should be given at least 1 h before or 3 h after sevelamer
  • swallow intact tablets; do not crush, chew, break into pieces, or take tablets apart prior to administration
  • take with meals

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• serum phosphorus target level 5.5 mg/dL or less
  • folic acid, vitamins D, E, and K levels
  • serum bicarbonate, chloride levels

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause hypotension, dyspepsia, nausea, or vomiting.
  • Advise patient to report signs/symptoms of thrombotic disorder.
  • Patient should take drug with meals and adhere to prescribed diet.
